content.description: Two different drugs, X and Y, are currently in use to treat a certain condition. About 7 percent of the people using either drug experience side effects. A random sample of 75 people using drug X and a random sample of 150 people using drug Y are selected. The proportion of people in each sample who experience side effects is recorded.
content.question: Are the sample sizes large enough to assume that the sampling distribution of the difference in sample proportions is approximately normal?

choices.label: Yes. Both sample sizes are large enough.
No. The sample size for drug X is large enough, but the sample size for drug Y is not.
No. The sample size for drug Y is large enough, but the sample size for drug X is not.
No. Neither sample size is large enough.
There is not enough information provided to determine whether the sampling distribution is approximately normal.

content.answer: No. The sample size for drug Y is large enough, but the sample size for drug X is not.

topic.text: 5.6: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Proportions
